item.title: In India Rape and Murder, Allegations of a Caste Conspiracy
item.description: Two girls, cousins who were 15 and 14, were found dead, their bodies hanging from mango trees in Uttar Pradesh State.
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS and HARI KUMAR

item.title: International Observers Find Fault with Egypt Vote
item.description: Two teams of foreign observers said the presidential election was marred by irregularities and a repressive political environment.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: May 29
item.description: A boy resting in a boat on a hot summer day in Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: A boy sleeping in a boat on a hot day in Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh.

item.title: Open Source: Director of ‘Happy in Tehran’ Video Is Reportedly Freed
item.description: The director of a YouTube remix that offended Iran’s judiciary was released on bail Thursday, a rights group said.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: India Ink: Rape Allegations in a Haryana Village Underscore a Social Fracas
item.description: Long-simmering tensions between low-caste residents of a village in North India and their upper-caste, largely landowning neighbors have boiled over after four girls said they were raped.
item.dc:creator: By NEHA DIXIT
item.media:description: A row of vacant houses that used to be inhabited by families of lower caste in Bhagana village, Hisar, Haryana.

item.title: General Among 14 Killed in Ukraine as Rebels Down Copter
item.description: Ukraine said that rebel forces had used Russian-made portable surface-to-air missiles to shoot down the helicopter outside a separatist stronghold.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW ROTH
item.media:description: Smoke rose from the crash site of a Ukrainian Army helicopter on Thursday outside Slovyansk.

item.title: Abbas Asks Palestinian Prime Minister to Seek New Government
item.description: The move could send Israeli-Palestinian relations into a tailspin and would disrupt any prospect of a resumption of American-brokered peace talks.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: Crusader Against Sex Trafficking Quits Amid Charges Stories Were Fabricated
item.description: The activist, Somaly Mam, resigned from the foundation bearing her name after Newsweek and others questioned her accounts about her past as a victim of the sex trade.
item.dc:creator: By GERRY MULLANY
item.media:credit: Tang Chhin Sothy/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Cambodian activist Somaly Mam helped draw millions of dollars to the cause of combating sex trafficking.

item.title: Pressure Builds to Oust Veterans Affairs Chief and Make Changes
item.description: The House and Senate are confronting the broadening health scandal at the department in ways that will challenge both parties to rethink the future of the medical system for veterans.
item.category: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
item.dc:creator: By JONATHAN WEISMAN
item.media:description: Eric Shinseki, the Veterans Affairs secretary, testified before the Senate on May 15.

item.title: Nine Scientists Are Awarded Kavli Prizes
item.description: The scientists will split $1 million prizes from the Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters for work in astrophysics, nanoscience and neuroscience.
item.dc:creator: By DENNIS OVERBYE

item.title: Letter From Europe: After Vote, a Rubicon Moment for E.U.?
item.description: Anti-European groups chose the European Parliament as their Trojan horse to assail the European Union from within.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: The leader of the French far-right National Front party, Marine Le Pen, with Geert Wilders, leader of the Party for Freedom in the Netherlands.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Pan-Africanism and the World Cup
item.description: A sense of community that often transcends borders is not shared by many of the continent’s leaders.
item.dc:creator: By MURITHI MUTIGA

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Poland’s Forgotten Dissident
item.description: The 25th anniversary of elections that lifted Solidarity to power is the moment to remember the role of Jacek Kuron.
item.dc:creator: By SLAWOMIR SIERAKOWSKI

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Thailand’s Army Tears Up the Script
item.description: This coup shows ominous signs of going beyond the pattern of temporary military rule before a resumption of democracy.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By DUNCAN MCCARGO

item.title: Putin Signs Economic Alliance With Kazakhstan and Belarus
item.description: The two countries joined Russia in creating the Eurasian Economic Union, a pale imitation of what had been envisioned as an eastern version of the European Union.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, left, his Kazakh counterpart Nursultan A. Nazarbayev, center, and President Alexander Lukashenko of Belarus in Astana, Kazakhstan, on Thursday.

item.title: Presidential Building Is Stormed in Restless Georgian Region
item.description: The embattled president of Abkhazia, a breakaway enclave of Georgia, called the action an armed power grab. But opposition leaders disputed his account.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
item.media:description: Protesters gathered peacefully outside the presidential headquarters in Sukhumi, the capital of Abkhazia, on Wednesday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China’s Most-Hated Official Is No Surprise
item.description: Urban management officials, or chengguan, are ranked last in popularity, behind school and hospital officials, village cadres, the police and bosses of state-owned enterprises.
item.dc:creator: By KIKI ZHAO
item.media:description: Chengguan officers, charged with enforcing urban order, explaining to a citizen why a motorcycle parked in the street violated city regulations.

item.title: Missing Plane Believed to Be Beyond Search Area
item.description: The hunt for the Malaysia Airlines jetliner will now shift to a larger section of the ocean than where a submersible vehicle has been searching.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE
item.media:description: A New Zealand Air Force plane participated in the search for the missing Malaysia Airlines plane in April off the coast of Perth, Australia.

item.title: Storming a Spanish Border in North Africa
item.description: More than 1,000 would-be immigrants tried to forced their way over razor-wire barriers into Spain’s North African enclave of Melilla on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS
item.media:description: Over 1,000 migrants tried to scale barriers to Spain’s North African enclave of Melilla on Wednesday. About half made it; some were beaten back by the police.

item.title: News Analysis: Rebutting Critics, Obama Seeks Higher Bar for Military Action
item.description: The United States should avoid getting dragged into the quicksand of international crises that have trapped some of his predecessors, President Obama said on Wednesday.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: At West Point, President Obama talked about being “haunted” by the deaths of four cadets.

item.title: World Briefing: Central African Republic: Deadly Attack at Church
item.description: Muslim rebels stormed a Catholic church compound in Bangui, the capital, on Wednesday in a deadly attack with gunfire and grenades, witnesses said.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Iran: MERS Virus Reaches Its 20th Country
item.description: A deadly virus that originated in Saudi Arabia two years ago has reached Iran, infecting two sisters in Kerman, the health ministry reported.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Lawmakers Ask State Dept. to Review Support for Honduras
item.description: More than 100 members of Congress, outlining the deteriorating human rights situation in Honduras, called for pressure on the Honduran government.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETH MALKIN

item.title: Defending His Actions, Snowden Says He’s a Patriot
item.description: In an NBC interview, Edward J. Snowden said he considered himself a patriot and criticized Russia on free-speech rights.
item.dc:creator: By ELENA SCHNEIDER and STEVE KENNY

item.title: Spanish Upstart Party Said It Could, and Did. Now the Hard Part Begins.
item.description: An anti-establishment, anti-austerity movement is trying to go beyond simply tapping into a nation’s anger.
item.dc:creator: By RAPHAEL MINDER
